critique: This document establishes guidelines for the Federal Civil Defense Administration regarding the employment of personnel, including part-time advisors and volunteers. It prioritizes full-time government employees but allows for exceptions when specialized skills are needed. It also includes measures to avoid conflicts of interest and exemptions from certain conflict of interest laws. The order delegates authority to the Administrator while also setting some limitations and reporting requirements. It is difficult to assess the ideological tilt of this document. It seems to be a fairly standard administrative order. There is nothing about immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, all of those axes should be scored as neutral.
